title.value: Novel informatics approaches to COVID-19 Research: From methods to applications
title.justification: The title is stated on the first page of the paper and is used to introduce the paper's focus on informatics approaches in COVID-19 research.
title.quote: Novel informatics approaches to COVID-19 Research: From methods to applications

extractions.description: The paper presents a collection of studies in a special issue of the Journal of Biomedical Informatics, focusing on the application of novel informatics methods to COVID-19 research, covering diverse topics such as clinical data analysis, epidemic modeling, text mining, and more.

type.justification: The paper summarizes empirical research studies and applications of informatics methods during the COVID-19 pandemic.
type.quote: Most papers were received in October of 2020; thus, many works in this collection were done in 2020.

name.justification: The paper focuses on the use of informatics, a biomedical field, in addressing COVID-19 related challenges and data analysis.
name.quote: The data-driven nature of biomedical research has made Biomedical Informatics ... very critical when combating the COVID-19 pandemic.

name.justification: The paper specifically addresses various research efforts related to COVID-19.
name.quote: To highlight the development and application of novel informatics approaches to collecting, integrating, harmonizing, and analyzing COVID-19 data for scientific discoveries and clinical practice...

name.justification: Several sections discuss machine learning applications for COVID-19, including prediction models and analysis techniques.
name.quote: Another challenge with forecasting studies can be the comparison of different models...

name.justification: Text mining and natural language processing methods have been used for extracting COVID-19 data from clinical texts and literature.
name.quote: As much important information of COVID-19 is embedded in narrative textual data sources...

name.justification: DDANet is mentioned as a novel deep learning model for segmenting COVID-19 lesion regions in lung CT scans.
name.quote: Rajamani et al. [41] proposed a new deep learning model called the Dynamic Deformable Attention Network (DDANet)...

is_contributed.justification: The model is proposed in another paper referenced within this special issue, not contributed by this paper.

is_executed.justification: The execution details are not provided in this paper but mentioned in the referenced study.

is_compared.justification: There are no details provided in this paper about comparisons with other models.

referenced_paper_title.value: Dynamic deformable attention network (DDANet) for COVID-19 lesions semantic segmentation
referenced_paper_title.justification: The model DDANet is referenced from Rajamani et al.'s paper on COVID-19 lesion segmentation.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Rajamani et al. [41] proposed a new deep learning model...
